name: Just Another Team's MnK rolls
description: Just Another Team's recommendations for weapons up to season 21. Recommended for Mouse and Keyboard.

data.description: Of the 140 HCs, Waking has a lower base range at 38 therefore it cannot really be a max range weapon, however, it does have great base handling. Due to the inability to fight at the extended ranges of 140s, sight choice can come down to which is preferred visually. Despite this, the sights which are normally ignored because of the stat penalties they incur (Sureshot & Crossfire) can be worth it to push the range out as far as possible.
60 base reload + 10 from mag perk + 10/20/40 form vorpal would be sufficient for reloads. Outlaw would max out reload (+60) but its not as consistently proc’d in higher level content.

While no longer as powerful as it used to be, Felwinters is still a guaranteed excellent roll on a still competitive shotgun frame in PvP. Surplus has become even less useful with the ability nerf, so personally I’d go all in on consistency and run Slideshot + Opening Shot. There are much better shotguns for PvE, but Felwinters does have a consistent roll with at least a good damage perk if you have nothing better.

While most of the PvE roll for Succession has stayed the same, the final perk has diversified quite a bit from the first release. Opening Shot is arguably the best in slot perk. Rangefinder is generally the go to (it does add ~3M of base range) but Hawkmoon is a run and gun weapon (in my opinion) - if you want range, run a 120 or Luna Faction boots. Opening Shot gives a serious bonus to accuracy on ground and in air and helps guarantee landing the first crit (or 7 stack OHKO if you wait for perk to reset). Moving Target is nearly worthless due to high base AA stat.

While most of the PvE roll for Succession has stayed the same, the final perk has diversified quite a bit from the first release. While Vorpal is still excellent for certain places (Cyclops’, etc), Focused Fury rises to the top for single target damage while solo, as it procs off only two shots despite having many more in the mag with Reconstruction and having Firing Line for dps in a team.
In PvP we’ve lost Killing Wind, but No Distractions keeps this sniper as one of the best for PvP

In PvE, the poor performance of the Precision hc is balanced with the excellent and unique perk pool. As the first weapon with Voltshot in the 3rd column, Posterity is worth getting for uniqueness alone - though the perks do elevate it into being usable despite the poor archetype.
In PvP this is just another Precision hc without an especially special damage perk to enable three taps, and no consistency perks. Better to look elsewhere for PvP

Commemoration reclaims its spot as the best Machine Gun in the game. The only Adaptive MG with Killing Tally and methods to get around manual reloading with Subsistence and Reconstruction makes this easily the best PvE Machine Gun. Reconstruction especially can let you fire all the reserves without ever losing your Killing Tally stacks.
For PvP - Don’t Bother. No good consistency or damage perks makes this pointless for use there compared to other MGs

This sniper has some interesting rolls. With KC and MKC it can get ohk body shots, and Vorpal makes it one of the ways to counter a behemoth super. However, these all roll in the same slot as the handling perks, so you are giving up better ads and feel for these build perks.

With the change to precision fusions in S16, Adaptives have risen in strength. Normally killing in 5 bolts at 6 resilience and below, High Impact Reserves or a charge time increase can make it 5 bolt all resilience and 9 resilience respectively. Then it’s a matter of improving the recoil direction to be as vertical as possible and getting as much stability and accuracy as you can. This is an excellent PvP fusion if you can just get a good roll on it.

A 120 handcannon which you can tailor to your liking. The extensive perk pool allows one to tailor this handcannon to your liking. Fluted Barrel and Steady Rounds help make up for the poor base stats, and Slideshot and Explosive Payload extend the range and improve the gun even more.

The medium zoom scopes add +3 / 4 to zoom which has a massive impact on damage drop off. Model 8 Red pushes it to 17 zoom which makes this the best in slot SMG by a long shot (get it? Because it has more range?) pushing a 60 stat SMG to 20M base range.

The medium zoom scopes add +3 / 4 to zoom which has a massive impact on damage drop off. Model 8 Red pushes it to 17 zoom which makes this the best in slot SMG by a long shot (get it? Because it has more range?) pushing a 60 stat SMG to 20M base range. Deciding between Kill Clip and Iron Reach comes down to deciding what you want your smg to be. Iron Reach gives it an extra 3m of range (and with smgs, every metre counts) making it a better dueling weapon, while Kill Clip’s damage buff gives it a nutty ttk and an excellent snowball machine.

With the change to precision fusions in S16, Adaptives have risen in strength. Normally killing in 5 bolts at 6 resilience and below, High Impact Reserves or a charge time increase can make it 5 bolt all resilience and 9 resilience respectively. Then it’s a matter of improving the recoil direction to be as vertical as possible and getting as much stability and accuracy as you can. This is an excellent PvP fusion if you can just get a good roll on it.

A 120 handcannon which you can tailor to your liking. The extensive perk pool allows one to tailor this handcannon to your liking. Personally I would go for a Slideshot + Explosive Payload roll, as Igneous Hammer does the neutral game better. Fluted Barrel and Steady Rounds help make up for the poor base stats, and Slideshot and Explosive Payload extend the range and improve the gun even more.

20 base zoom (+4 over the others and +2 over Horror Story with Med scope) makes this best in class for range. Arrowhead + Rico + Killing Wind + MKC/HIR/KW + 68 range (=88 range) = 38m which beats 100 range 16 zooms by nearly 2M.

Frenzy is +50 to reload, so that perk alone puts Fatebringer at max reload speed. Loader will still add a scalar so it will be faster. Kill Clip does not boost Explosive Payload damage, just the impact damage. Explosive sometimes interferes with Firefly explosions.

Kill Clip does not improve TTK - just forgiveness and effective range. Opening Shot is still likely the best in slot, but do not sleep on Eye of the Storm for a mid-duel consistency boost, because of its mid-combat proc condition often occuring during 1v1 duels, the accuracy bump EotS grants could be excellent for finishing a fight.

Choosing between Reservoir Burst and HIR in PvE depends on the situation. HIR for boss damage and Reservoir Burst for general use and add clear. HIR is the clear winner for PvP, since it reduces the bolts needed for a kill while procced, and one stack of Heating Up makes the recoil perfectly vertical for easier bolt control.

In PvP Eyasluna does not reach the same ranges that Adept Fate can, while still “wasting” a perk slot on Rangefinder. However this allows it to reach into more interesting builds while not focusing wholly on range. If you prefer the feel of Eyasluna then a Rangefinder + Moving Target roll is the play for the range, but Unrelenting is a surprisingly good 6s perk, while Demo can be used to better use your now slower charging grenades.

The God Combo of Quickdraw + Snapshot returns on a 90 rpm sniper. Personally I’d go all in on Handling with a Qd + Snap sniper, to help with the stow speed and attempt to match the old version of Quickdraw as closely as possible (potentially even using Quick Access Sling if you can justify the loss of the option of air shots. Despite the return of the old combo, don’t discount Firmly Planted as an excellent accuracy booster when crouching.

The crafted version of this weapon can get Enhanced Overflow, which when combined with Extended Mag can get a 16 round mag in PvE. This pairs extremely well with an Auto Loading Heavy weapon if you want to use an exotic primary, or even just as an alternative to a Triple Tap sniper to eliminate reload time (note, Triple Tap is still superior to Overflow if you hit all crits thanks to pulling ammo from thin air instead of taking from reserves)

While Under Your Skin rolls the classic combo of Archers Tempo + Explosive Head, it might be worth for some people to forgo the slight damage increase of Explosive and instead go for an Adaptive Munitions roll. This perk allows the bow to essentially ignore Match Game, as it gives an eventual 600% damage increase against non-Void elemental shields. With an Adaptive Munitions roll, you could theoretically delete all other elemental bows and only use an Under Your Skin god roll and still be just as effective. An excellent vault cleaning roll.

Smallbore and Accurized work together to reach 60 range, important for the consistent ohk range of 6-7m on Aggressive frames. As the only Kinetic Aggressive shotgun with Elemental Capacitor, this rules the slot on an Arc subclass. However being able to keep Frenzy procc’d through constant combat in 6s or peakshooting and other chip damage methods would give a huge boost to handling and an excellent damage buff for defensive shotgunning. My personal take is for Ele cap and use a different shotgun on Arc, but if you can keep Frenzy running in those important moments this shotgun can bis for all subclasses.

This handcannon is stacked with good PvP perks, and there very nearly isn’t a bad perk combination on the weapon. The suggested EotS + Opening Shot roll is excellent for 1 on 1 dueling, giving accuracy boosts at practically every part of the gunfight, but it’s not alone at the top. Some other suggested perk combinations; EotS + Rangefinder to duel at 35m, HFG + Opening Shot for closer range primary, Compulsive Reloader + Moving Target to reduce flinch and improve passive aa as much as possible, the possibilities are tremendous. Cantana has a low recoil direction of 85 (hand canons have a floor of 80) so arrowhead would be a best in slot pick.

A pulse with a huge number of excellent PvE rolls that is let down by the horrendous archetype for both PvE and PvP. Subsistence is BiS thanks to not giving a 100% return rate and thus still allowing usage of the Souldrinker innate perk (and even extending the number of possible kills) combined with either a damage or utility perk (frenzy or demo respectively) gives an excellent SMG. (Perpetual Motion would scale better into harder content, but subs still works well enough in master raids and SMGs shouldn't really be used in GMs)

PvP: it falls short of Multimach's range surpremacy but with that weapon being removed from the IB loot pool it offers an alternative for any new players. Max range and the option to extend the range further with KW or a damage perk

Subsistence is BiS thanks to not giving a 100% return rate and thus still allowing usage of the Souldrinker innate perk (and even extending the number of possible kills) combined with either a damage or utility perk (frenzy or demo respectively) gives an excellent SMG. (Perpetual Motion would scale better into harder content, but subs still works well enough in master raids and SMGs shouldn't really be used in GMs)

PvP: it falls short of Multimach's range surpremacy but with that weapon being removed from the IB loot pool it offers an alternative for any new players. Max range and the option to extend the range further with KW or a damage perk

The first non-sunset Adaptive smg to return to the game, Hero’s Burden poses an interesting question. Can you deal with 10 stability (0 if you lack Ricochet) and the massive flinch that grants in order to achieve one of the longest ranges an smg can get? If yes, then go all in on Range with Full Bore and Iron Reach. If no, then you’ve still got a solid option with Hammer forged and Kill Clip that is let down by it’s mediocre 3rd column and 14 zoom

A unique GL, in that every single shot proc’s Chill Clip and applies 50 stacks of slow. Slow one enemy with a direct hit, and blind everyone around it with Blinding nades. Note that Chill Clip does not proc at all if Ambitious Assassin is the chosen perk, so avoid it and Proximity Nades (Which prevent the grenade from direct hitting at all) if you want to freeze enemies.

A rare PvP fusion that rolls with Rangefinder, putting it as the Adaptive version of Loaded Question for its slightly deeper ohk kills than others of its archetypes. Liquid Coils is an option for ohk at 5 bolts on all resiliences. Controller users are better off maximizing range for fusions in PvP, so a roll with Hammer Forged + Projection Fuse is more worthwhile

Another Void 750, but this blows The Title out of the water with its wide selection of perks. 3rd column Best In Slot is easily Demo, but this can be paired well with practically any final column damage perk. Frenzy for a consistent damage increase, Golden Tricorn for the largest damage increase after fully proccing the perk (Demo helps grenade uptime just for this). Don’t knock Repulsor Brace for a full Void build to assist survivability with relatively consistent 45hp Void Overshields

While not beating out Pardon Our Dust for availability or in it’s perkpool, Militia’s can work as a replacement to the now unobtainable Grenade Launcher “Ignition Code”, which could roll with Slideshot. With Slideways’ cooldown timer being longer than Slideshot it cannot pull off the same mass blinding as Ignition could, but it can still send two blinding grenades down range faster than any other launcher without a “slide” perk.

A 120 hand cannon with some very interesting rolls. The more classic stat boosting perks with Perpetual Motion and EotS or Elemental Capacitor gives you a good feeling aggressive handcannon, but Focused Fury allows for a “mini-Hawkmoon” type playstyle, allowing for two taps on 7 resilience and below for 11 seconds after landing four headshots over the whole mag.

Taipan is a LFR with an exceptional perk pool and the best dps heavy weapon origin trait in the game. Triple Tap + Firing Line allows it to be used as an ammo efficient total damage machine, Clown Cartridge + Firing Line allows you to optimise dps while maintaining good innate total damage and Field Prep + Frenzy gives an excellent Nightfall heavy weapon for Void Singe’s. Veist Stinger is the cherry on top, occasionally giving full mag refills, and even more rarely meaning you never need to reload over the entirety of a raid boss damage phase.

An exceptional PvE scout, with EP + Frenzy for two high uptime damage buffs and extremely easy to get a god roll thanks to crafting. An honourable mention goes to Firefly + Dragonfly as a fun at-level roll. Double explosions and a reload boost means this gun spreads havoc. (and can work as a mini primary cloudstrike with the double explosions oneshotting Guardians of 7 resilience and under with a 10% damage buff like Radiant)

The monster shotgun returns, this time with a crappy perk pool. Aggressive shotguns are in a rough spot right now, with only Timelost Found Verdict reaching ohk ranges longer than Lightweights. Without a stacked stat package and no Opening Shot, Mindbenders lacks any of the things that can let Aggressives compete in this meta. Despite having a better handling perk than Found Verdict, it cannot stack up in any other way.

This Hand Cannon cannot have a one and done God Roll for PvP. Practically every perk other than Vorpal is an S tier Crucible perk, and to lock you into my favourite roll is doing Rose an injustice. This is a gun where you need to experiment and find out what your god roll is. For some suggestions I’d look into Moving Target + Rangefinder for consistency and range, Slideshot + EotS for moving from duel to duel and Perpetual Motion + Explosive Payload for consistency and dueling within a closer range - but this gun will shine best in your hands with your build on it. Maximise the stats and get the engagement range above 30m and this will be hands down the best PvP Hand cannon in the Kinetic Slot

While unfortunately Long Arm hasn’t quite stacked up as the Legendary  Dead Man’s Tale, it still shines in it’s own niche. While normally I’d suggest Rapid Hit over all others, the long reload time means that Rapid Hit falls off after only a couple of bullets reloaded. Either go into Wellspring and commit to Scout Reloaders and reload boosters, or run with Compulsive Reloader and try not go below half ammo.
leaning into the Legendary DMT vibe is probably best, with Hipfire Grip to improve the hipfire and Explosive Payload or Opening Shot for consistency/flinch

Revision Zero is another extremely customisable exotic, with many choices for the perks. The biggest choices outside of stat perks is whether to go for the two shot Heavy Burst or the four shot Light Burst. In general this is another choice for the player - the two burst tends to be better in general but stacks the exotic perk much slower, while the four burst is slightly worse for general usage but stacks the exotic perk much faster.

Revision Zero is another extremely customisable exotic, with many choices for the perks. The biggest choices outside of stat perks is whether to go for the two shot Heavy Burst or the four shot Light Burst. In general this is another choice for the player - the two burst tends to be better in general but stacks the exotic perk much slower, while the four burst is slightly worse for AB shield breaking and general usage but stacks the exotic perk much faster. In reference to using Revision as a primary dps option - you need to stack up the perk before-hand and limit yourself from using an alternative DPS option or a kinetic special. As such, it’s much better to use Touch of Malice (if you have 3 or more people eventually planning to use it and can cycle the debuff), Hierarchy of Needs (if you have the needed distance) or Outbreak Perfected (if you’ve nothing else - as it’s a better primary dps weapon to swap to)

For the S17 rolls, Under Pressure + Iron Grip works excellently as a workhorse, with the S20 roll unfortunately only being able to get one of the stability improving perks with Iron Grip + HIR. However S20 Wizened Rebukes have access to the exceptional perk combination of Offhand Strike + Successful Warm-Up, turning this Fusion into a excellent kill chaining weapon

The return of Astral Horizon has been overshadowed by this gun. With Imperial Decree being craftable, getting the same PvP god roll as Astral and having more points in literally every single stat Astral is now pointless against this gun. If you’re looking for a kinetic Aggressive shotgun for PvP, then this is the place to go

A weapon to match up against Palindrome as the new best PvP Energy Handcannon. With good PvE rolls, this gun truly shines in PvP. With a huge number of PvP perks, a pure dueling roll with Rangefinder and EotS might be the best for general use - but you can get a lot of work out of many of the more kill focused perks

Budge over a bit Forbearance, there’s a new add clear Wave Frame in town. Being able to match Forbearance in add clear potential with Destabilising Rounds, Harsh Language takes it’s place at the top alongside Forebearance as a spectacular add clear wave frame. However don’t let it’s pure add clear potential steer you away from other perk options, Repulsor Brace works great with various Volatile Round builds (especially Gyrfalcons)

What a turn up for the Books!! Apex Predator going from the worst rocket in the game to the best rocket in the game. While it’s still entirely ignorable as just another Tracking Module rocket for PvP, in PvE it outdamages a comparable Explosive Light rocket after three rockets, and over the course of the whole reserves you’re looking at a not inconsiderable damage increase!
